Comparing Two Different Files

You can compare any two text files with Visual Diff. Depending on your editor and environment, you can edit the file or files, then click the Visual Diff window for an immediate update of their differences.

Although you can compare binary files with Visual Diff, it is generally more effective to compare them in the application in which they were created. If all you need to know is whether they are identical, however, Visual Diff makes this comparison easily and effectively.

If you attempt to compare vastly different files (that is, files of different types), Visual Diff displays a message stating that the files are too different to compare and does not display them.

For identical files, Visual Diff also displays a message instead of a file comparison.

To compare two different files (starting from the Visual Diff window):

  1. From the Visual Diff window, select File > Open Files from the menu bar or click the Open button on the toolbar. The Open dialog displays.

  2. Select the first file to be compared. The Open dialog displays again.

  3. Select the second file to be compared. Visual Diff then compares the files, so that you can see the differences between them.

  4. If desired, edit and save one or both of the files in the appropriate editor, leaving the files in Visual Diff open. Visual Diff then automatically re-compares the file, based on your changes.

  5. To return to the application's main window, select File > Exit from the Visual Diff menu.

To compare two different files (starting from the application's main window):

  1. In the application, select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Select the File tab.

  3. Select two files from the File list.

  4. Do one of the following:

    • Click the Compare Contents button on the toolbar.

    • Select Compare Contents from the File menu or context menu.

    Visual Diff displays the two files and their differences.

  5. If desired, edit and save one or both of the files in the appropriate editor, leaving the files open in Visual Diff. Visual Diff then automatically re-compares the file, based on your changes.

  6. To return to the application's main window, select File > Exit from the Visual Diff menu.
